hillbillies.model

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Boulder, Log

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for general GameObject (Boulder or Log).
    Invariants:
  • The world must be effective
        this.getWorld() != null.
  • The position must be valid
        this.getWorld().isValidPosition(this.getPosition())
  • The weight must be between 10 and 50 inclusive.
        this.getWeight() >= 10 && this.getWeight() <= 50

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      protected GameObject(World world, IntVector location)
      Creates a new gameObject in a given world an at a given location.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        protected GameObject(World world,
                     IntVector location)
              throws InvalidPositionException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new gameObject in a given world an at a given location.
        Parameters:
        world - The world in which the gameObject needs to be created.
        location - The location at which the gameObject needs to be created.
        Postconditions:
      • The position is set to the middle of the cube of the given position.
      • The weight of the object is random between 10 and 50.
        • Effect:
        The position is set
            new.setPosition(location.toVector().add(Terrain.Lc/2))
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The world isn't effective. | world == null
        InvalidPositionException

    • Method Detail

      • getPosition

        @Basic
public Vector getPosition()
        Returns the position of the gameObject.

      • advanceTime

        public void advanceTime(double dt)
        Updates the state of the game object.
        Parameters:
        dt - The time step that is taken.
        Postcondition:
        If the object is not above a solid cube or the world ground, then it falls at the falling speed.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Vector pos)
                 throws InvalidPositionException
        Sets the position of the game object.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to which the object should be moved.
        Postcondition:
        The new position of the object will be the given position.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - The position is not valid or the position is a solid cube.

      • getWeight

        @Immutable
 @Basic
public int getWeight()
        Returns the weight of the game object.
